required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Taking Charge of Systemic Sclerosis: Improving Patient Outcomes Through Self-management

brief_summary.textblock: This Study is a collaborative project with partners (people with scleroderma and stakeholders) designed to refine an internet program for patients with scleroderma and to compare the internet program to an authoritative educational book (Taking Charge of Systemic Sclerosis [TOSS]). During a 16-week comparative effectiveness 16-week randomized controlled trial, the investigators will recruit up to 250 patients who will be randomized to either TOSS or authoritative book for patients, The Scleroderma Book: A Guide for Patients and Families.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Managing Symptoms Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8
primary_outcome.description: Managing Symptoms score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life on the European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Index Scale
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D index scale uses a conversion algorithm to convert the raw scores into a health utility measure, ranging from 0.0 (death) to 1.0 (full or optimal health).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Confidence in Self Management on the Patient Activation Measure Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient Activation Measure (PAM) is a 13-item measure that assesses patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management. Each item is scored from 1 (strongly disagree) to 4 (strongly agree). PAM scores were categorized into 4 levels: level 1, the individual is disengaged/overwhelmed; level 2, the individual is aware but struggling; level 3, the individual is taking action;and level 4, the individual is maintaining behavior. The analysis will look at any change in these levels where level 4 denotes someone as full "activated".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Brief Satisfaction on the Satisfaction With Appearance Scale (SWAP) Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The Brief Satisfaction with Appearance Scale (SWAP) is a 6-item scale measuring body image concerns and social discomfort with body parts. It is scored from 0 to 36, with higher scores associated with greater dissatisfaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Managing Daily Activities Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Managing Daily Activities score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Managing Emotions score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Managing Medications and Treatment Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months

Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical Function Scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 Outcome Measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Physical Function domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents better physical function, a lower score represents poorer physical function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Social Role Scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 Outcome Measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Social role domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents better social role functioning and a lower score represents poorer social role functioning.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much), this provides a raw score. secondary_outcome.measure: Change Pain Interference Scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 Outcome Measure

A higher score represents worse symptomatology, a lower score represents better symptomatology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analogue Scale Pain Intensity Scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 Outcome Measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analogue scale pain intensity in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® is scored as 0 being no pain and 10 being the worst imaginable pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep Disturbance Scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 Outcome Measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep disturbance domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much),this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents worse symptomatology, a lower score represents better symptomatology.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
other_outcome.description: The Patient Health Questionnaire-8 (PHQ-8) is an 8-item questionnaire that is commonly used to measure depressive symptoms. A score of ≥10 is consistent with depressed mood with a score ranging from 0 to 24.

arm_group.description: Internet-based self-management program Patients randomized to active treatment intervention will be assigned to the Internet program. The site will be accessed via secured website. The modules will be presented 1-2 per week and will be moderated by a researcher with expertise in moderating Discussion Boards.
Educational book group. Participants in the control group will receive a copy of The Scleroderma Book: A Guide for Patients and Families, by Dr. Maureen Mayes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All participants will be residents of the United States
- Diagnosed with systemic scleroderma,
- 18 years of age
- Possess basic computer literacy and have access to a computer with Internet and email capabilities
- Have the ability to communicate in English
Exclusion Criteria:
- No computer access
- Inability to communicate in English

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study recruitment occurred at two sites, The University of Michigan and the Medical University of South Carolina. Recruitment also took place utilizing social media, with the help of our patient partners and the Sclerderma Foundation and Scleroderma Research Foundation.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants completed baseline questionnaires. Participants were randomized to the intervention or control condition using a 1:1 ratio and computer-generated block randomization, and were stratified based on scores on the Patient Health Questionnaire-8 (<10, >10) in the baseline questionnaire.

group.title: Internet-based Self-management Program
group.description: Internet-based self-management program Patients randomized to active treatment intervention will be assigned to the Internet program. The site will be accessed via secured website. The modules will be presented 1-2 per week and will be moderated by a researcher with expertise in moderating Discussion Boards. Internet-based self-management program

group.description: Educational book group. Participants in the control group will receive a copy of The Scleroderma Book: A Guide for Patients and Families, by Dr. Maureen Mayes. Scleroderma book

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
Managing Symptoms Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8
measure.description: Managing Symptoms score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident). The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage symptoms.

measure.title: Quality of Life on the European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Scale
measure.description: The (EQ-5D) provides a generic health-related quality of life assessment. The 5 domains listed in each row are scored into 3 levels, level 1 (no problem), level 2 (some problems), level 3 (extreme problems). Visual analogue scale is a vertical scale with end points of 0 and 100, 0 corresponds to " the worst health you can imagine", and 100 corresponds to "the best health you can imagine". Using a conversion algorithm, the EQ-5D index patient responses are converted into a health utility measure, ranging from 0.0 (death) to 1.0 (full or optimal health).

measure.title: Confidence in Self Management on the Patient Activation Measure Scale
measure.description: The Patient Activation Measure (PAM) is a 13-item measure that assesses patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management.PAM scores were categorized into 4 levels: level 1, the individual is disengaged/overwhelmed; level 2, the individual is aware but struggling; level 3, the individual is taking action;and level 4, the individual is maintaining behavior.The summed score is finally transformed into a 0-100 point scale with higher scores indicating more confidence and knowledge in patients managing their condition

measure.title: Appearance Satisfaction on the Satisfaction With Appearance Scale (SWAP) Scale
measure.description: The Brief Satisfaction with Appearance Scale (SWAP) is a 6-item scale measuring body image concerns and social discomfort with body parts. It is scored from 0 to 36, with higher scores associated with greater dissatisfaction.

measure.title: Managing Daily Activities Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8
measure.description: Managing Daily Activities score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage daily actvities.

measure.title: Managing Emotions Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 [
measure.description: Managing Emotions score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident) this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage emotions.

measure.description: Managing Medication and Treatment score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident) this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage medications and treatments.

measure.title: Managing Social Interactions Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8
measure.description: Managing Social Interactions score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident) this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage social interactions.

measure.title: Physical Function scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 outcome measure
measure.description: Physical Function domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10.A higher score represents better physical function, a lower score represents poorer physical function.

measure.title: Social Role scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 outcome measure
measure.description: Social role domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents worse symptomatology, a lower score represents better symptomatology.

measure.title: Anxiety scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 outcome measure
measure.description: Anxiety domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much),this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents worse symptomatology, a lower score represents better symptomatology.

measure.title: Depression scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 outcome measure
measure.description: Depression domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much),this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents worse symptomatology, a lower score represents better symptomatology.

measure.title: Fatigue scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 outcome measure
measure.description: Fatigue domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much),this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents worse symptomatology, a lower score represents better symptomatology.

measure.title: Pain Interference scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 outcome measure
measure.description: Pain interference domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much). A raw score is created from each short form that makes up the Profile. To find the total raw score for a short form with all questions answered, sum the values of the response to each question within each domain. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents worse symptomatology, a lower score represents better symptomatology.

measure.title: Visual Analogue Scale Pain Intensity scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 outcome measure
measure.description: the visual analogue scale pain intensity in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored as 0 being no pain and 10 being the worst imaginable pain.

measure.title: Sleep Disturbance scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 outcome measure
measure.description: Sleep disturbance domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much),this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents worse symptomatology, a lower score represents better symptomatology.

measure.title: PHQ-8
measure.description: The Patient Health Questionnaire-8 (PHQ-8) is an 8-item questionnaire that is commonly used to measure depressive symptoms. The minimum score is 0 with a maximum score of 24. A score of ≥10 is consistent with depressed mood, a score of ≥20 is consistent with severely depressed mood.

outcome.title: Change in Managing Symptoms Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8
outcome.description: Managing Symptoms score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage symptoms.
outcome.population: Population analyzed at 6 months differs due to drop outs shown in participant flow table.

measure.title: Change in Managing Medications and Treatment Scale on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8
measure.description: Managing Medication and Treatment score on the PROMIS® Self-efficacy Short Form 8 consists of 8 items scored from 1 (not at all confident) to 5 (very confident), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. Higher scores are indicative of greater ability to manage symptoms.
measure.population: Population analyzed at 6 months differs due to drop outs shown in participant flow table.

outcome.title: Change in Physical Function Scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 Outcome Measure
outcome.description: Physical Function domain in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® are scored from 1 (unable to do/never/not at all) to 5 (without any difficulty/always/very much), this provides a raw score. The raw score is translated to a T-Score using a conversion table supplied by the Assessment Center. A score of 50 is the average for the US general population with a standard deviation of 10. A higher score represents better physical function, a lower score represents poorer physical function.

outcome.title: Change in Visual Analogue Scale Pain Intensity Scale on the PROMIS® 29 Profile v 2.0 Outcome Measure
outcome.description: The visual analogue scale pain intensity in the PROMIS-29 Profile v2.0® is scored as 0 being no pain and 10 being the worst imaginable pain.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months

outcome.title: Change in PHQ-8
outcome.description: The Patient Health Questionnaire-8 (PHQ-8) is an 8-item questionnaire that is commonly used to measure depressive symptoms. A score of ≥10 is consistent with depressed mood with a score ranging from 0 to 24.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline compared to 16 weeks and 6 months
outcome.population: Population analyzed at 6 months differs due to drop outs shown in participant flow table.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
